meanings.definition: A minor trend that is part of a larger trend.
meanings.sent1: The subtrend of wearing oversized hats is popular this season.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a subtrend of people using reusable water bottles.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the subtrend of everyone wearing mismatched socks was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The subtrend of neon colors in fashion is like a bright splash in a sea of neutrals.
meanings.sent5: The subtrend of online shopping has changed the way we buy things.

meanings.definition: To follow a trend that is not the main focus.
meanings.sent1: I decided to subtrend by adding some vintage pieces to my wardrobe.
meanings.sent2: She likes to subtrend by experimenting with different hairstyles.
meanings.sent3: He subtrended by wearing a Hawaiian shirt to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: Subtrending with bold accessories can make a simple outfit stand out.
meanings.sent5: Subtrending in music means exploring genres beyond the mainstream.
